description: Named from Henry Peter, Lord Brougham (1778–1868), who either invented or popularized the vehicle.

entries.meaning: A four-wheeled horse-drawn carriage, designed in 1839. It had an open seat for the driver in front of the closed cabin for two or four passengers.
examples: “Yes,” he continued, glancing out of the window. “A nice little brougham and a pair of beauties.”

entries.meaning: An automobile, a sedan without a roof over the driver's seat.
